ss-entry-simple.content-note: Slovenia participated in the common European currency, the euro, with effect from 1 January 2007; a fixed exchange rate of €1 = 239.640 tolars was in operation. The euro and the tolar circulated alongside each other until 14 January, after which time the euro (comprising 100 cent) became the sole legal tender.
